annotation.summary: A highly skilled and composed combat specialist who excels under pressure, using precision and tactical expertise to eliminate targets efficiently.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains an increase to their Dexterity attribute as part of their class features.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level in the specified class.

annotation.summary: The character gains additional maximum hit points equal to a specified value at 1st level and at each subsequent level.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: The character uses their training to offer strategic advice to allies, stay vigilant for deception, or lead discussions on topics they understand well.
annotation.prerequisites: requires relevant knowledge or training

annotation.summary: Describes how an operative character gains abilities, noting that higher-level abilities specify the level at which they are obtained.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be an operative class character.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains not only their class features but also the benefits granted by their chosen ancestry and background.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level and have selected an ancestry and background.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains specific proficiency ranks in certain statistics, and is untrained in all others unless improved through other means.
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level

annotation.summary: The character gains training in one skill based on their specialization, plus additional trained skills equal to 3 plus their Intelligence modifier.
annotation.prerequisites: must have a chosen specialization and an Intelligence score

annotation.summary: The character possesses varying proficiency levels with different weapon categories, being expert with simple and martial guns, and trained with advanced guns, simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated; assumes access to firearm and weapon training options.

annotation.summary: This table outlines the progression of an Operative class from levels 1 to 20, detailing the features gained at each level such as attribute boosts, feats, skill increases, and class-specific abilities like Aim, Operative’s Edge, and Tactical Barrage. It shows how the character’s combat precision, mobility, and specialization improve over time.
annotation.action_economy: The 'Aim' ability appears to scale with level (1d4 to 4d4), implying a combat action that consumes part of a turn’s action economy, likely a single action focused on precision attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be an Operative class; progression assumes meeting level requirements and any feat or skill prerequisites as listed in the rulebook.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists key character creation and progression elements, including ancestry, background, attribute boosts, starting proficiencies, a sharpshooter ability with an Aim action dealing 1d4, and operative-specific features such as specialization and feats.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be an operative or have access to operative features.

annotation.summary: A list of character progression elements including an aiming action with a 2d4 roll, an ancestry feat, attribute boosts, a master gunner feature, a skill increase, and an urban operator specialization.
annotation.action_economy: Aim action likely consumes a single action or similar unit depending on system rules.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to ancestry feats, firearm proficiency for master gunner, and relevant skill ranks for urban operator.

annotation.summary: A list of character progression features or abilities that enhance an operative’s capabilities, including feats, skill improvements, and weapon proficiency bonuses.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must meet level or class requirements for each listed feature.

annotation.summary: A set of character options including an ancestry feat, an enhanced exploit ability, improved operative resilience, and a skill increase.
annotation.prerequisites: None listed

annotation.summary: The section grants an attribute increase and allows the character to select both an operative-specific feat and a general skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: character level meeting the advancement milestone

annotation.summary: A general feat that enhances ranged precision using a 3d4 roll mechanic, grants additional movement of 5 feet while aiming, and benefits from operative expertise and a skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: likely one action to aim or move

annotation.summary: A list of character advancement options or features that can be selected as a character progresses, including attribute improvements, combat precision, general feats, enhanced weapon proficiency, skill upgrades, and specialized skill training.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; these are passive or progression-based options rather than actions taken in play.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by feature; may require specific levels, class features, or prior skill training.

annotation.summary: A skill feat for operatives that increases the character's movement speed by 10 feet.
A list of character options and actions including an aiming action, an ancestry-based feat, a resource called resolve, a skill advancement, and a tactical attack option.
annotation.action_economy: Aim and Tactical Barrage likely consume actions during combat; other elements are passive or character-building choices.
annotation.prerequisites: Ancestry feat requires a specific ancestry; skill increase requires level advancement; tactical barrage may require proficiency or a specific class feature.

annotation.summary: The section lists character progression elements gained at a certain level, including attribute boosts, an operative-specific feat, and a general skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level or class feature threshold that grants these benefits.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains four free ability boosts in addition to those granted by their class.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains specific proficiencies that reflect their initial training, as listed in the class description.
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level in the class

annotation.summary: Grants the ability to identify and exploit an enemy’s weak points, increasing precision damage with ranged weapons and providing access to the Aim action.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: You designate a visible creature as your mark, gaining a temporary bonus to ranged attacks against it. Until the end of your turn, your ranged Strikes deal extra precision damage and partially ignore cover, but only within your weapon’s first range increment. You can maintain only one mark at a time.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be aware of the target and use the required ranged weapon

annotation.summary: The Aim ability improves as the operative gains levels, increasing precision damage dice and reducing the cover bonus to AC that the target receives.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; applies when using the Aim ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Operative class; access to the Aim ability.

annotation.summary: Operatives select a specialization that defines their tactical style, granting training in a skill, a related skill feat, and an exploit. At 9th level, they gain an enhanced version of that exploit.
annotation.action_economy: None (character creation and level progression feature)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be an operative class character

annotation.summary: This feature represents a character skilled in stealth, infiltration, and deception, capable of entering and exiting locations undetected while completing objectives. It grants training in Deception and a Deception-related skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: Allows a character to Aim at targets they are undetected by without spending an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be undetected by the target

annotation.summary: Enhanced Exploit allows a character to remain undetected even after engaging an enemy and grants access to the Ghost Tap action.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires the Exploit ability or feature

annotation.summary: The character is adept at infiltrating secure areas and disabling or avoiding security measures. They receive training in the Computers skill and gain a related skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: The Exploit feature allows the character to interfere with technology, causing glitches or malfunctions, and grants access to the Sabotage action.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: This entry lists the traits or keywords associated with an action or ability, indicating it requires focus, involves deliberate physical or mental effort, and is tied to the Operative class or archetype.
Allows a character with expertise in Computers to sabotage a technological creature or item within a certain range, which increases with higher proficiency levels.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency in Computers

annotation.summary: If the Sabotage attempt fails, the target becomes temporarily immune to further Sabotage attempts until the end of your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: No additional actions; effect lasts until end of next turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have attempted a Sabotage action.

annotation.summary: On a critical failure, the sabotage attempt backfires, and the target becomes immune to further sabotage attempts for 10 minutes.
annotation.prerequisites: Attempting a Sabotage action

annotation.summary: Allows the user to perform a Sabotage action as a free action when critically hitting a tech creature, or as a reaction when a tech creature or a creature using a tech weapon critically fails a melee attack against them.

action_economy.free_action: Sabotage on a critical hit against a tech creature
action_economy.reaction: Sabotage when a tech creature or a creature using a tech weapon critically fails a melee attack against you

prerequisites: Ability to perform the Sabotage action
Target must be a tech creature or using a tech weapon

annotation.summary: This feature represents a character who excels at long-range, stealthy attacks, favoring precision over direct confrontation. It grants training in Stealth and a Stealth-related skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: This ability removes the unwieldy and volley traits from sniper group guns you use and grants you a bonus operative feat, either Keep Them in Your Sights or Scope Sight.
annotation.prerequisites: Must wield guns from the sniper weapon group.

annotation.summary: When you miss your first ranged Strike against your marked target with a sniper weapon, you can reload it for free, and the missed attack doesn’t increase your multiple attack penalty.
annotation.action_economy: Free action (triggered on a missed first ranged Strike against your mark)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a marked target and be using a weapon from the sniper weapon group

annotation.summary: Replaces martial gun proficiency progression with proficiency in one-handed agile and finesse melee weapons, agile and finesse unarmed attacks, and simple guns for characters with expert proficiency in those weapon types.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency with one-handed melee weapons and unarmed attacks that have the agile or finesse traits.

annotation.summary: This rule allows a character to use the Aim action with one-handed melee or unarmed attacks that have the agile or finesse trait, treating them as ranged weapons for the purpose of operative feats. It also permits substituting a melee or unarmed Strike for a ranged Strike when using such feats.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the same action cost as the Aim action.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use the Aim action; access to one-handed melee or unarmed attacks with the agile or finesse trait.

annotation.summary: The character gains the ability to perform an Overwhelming Strike as a free action, representing their improved capability to overpower studied foes.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the ability to study foes or meet conditions specified by the Overwhelming Strike feature.

annotation.summary: The ability applies one of three conditions—enfeebled 1, off-guard, or suppressed—to a target until the end of the user's next turn, after which the target gains temporary immunity to Overwhelming Strike for the same duration.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to the Overwhelming Strike ability

annotation.summary: At 1st level and every even-numbered level thereafter, the character gains an operative class feat, which can be selected from the list starting on page 131.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be an operative of at least 1st level.

annotation.summary: Starting at 2nd level and every two levels after, the character gains a skill feat, provided they are trained or better in the related skill.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be trained or better in the associated skill.

annotation.summary: At specific levels (3rd, 7th, and 15th), the character gains a skill feat related to the skill associated with their operative specialization.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be an operative with a trained skill from their specialization.

annotation.summary: Grants increased proficiency with guns, raising ranks to master for simple and martial guns and to expert for advanced guns, and provides access to critical specialization effects for guns with expert proficiency.
annotation.prerequisites: Must already have proficiency with guns.

annotation.summary: This feature enhances perceptive abilities, raising the character's Perception proficiency to master and granting a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls, which increases to +3 if the Incredible Initiative feat is taken.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated; benefits improve if the character has the Incredible Initiative feat.

annotation.summary: This feature increases the damage dealt with weapons and unarmed attacks based on your proficiency level: +2 for expert, +3 for master, and +4 for legendary.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency with the weapon or unarmed attacks

annotation.summary: Grants a status bonus to Speed that starts at +5 feet and increases to +10 feet at 16th level.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: The character improves their operative class DC proficiency from trained to expert, making their abilities more difficult to resist.
annotation.prerequisites: Operative class; trained proficiency in operative class DC

annotation.summary: Grants increased proficiency ranks with various weapon categories, emphasizing exceptional skill with firearms and improved competence with other weapons and unarmed attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: Character recognized as a local legend or meeting level-based proficiency advancement requirements.

annotation.summary: When you Aim and hit your marked target with a ranged Strike for the first time each round, you apply your weapon's critical specialization effect even without a critical hit.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered by the first successful ranged Strike after using Aim each round
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a marked target and have used the Aim action before the Strike

annotation.summary: Increases weapon specialization damage bonuses based on proficiency level: +4 for expert, +6 for master, and +8 for legendary with weapons or unarmed attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency or higher with the weapon or unarmed attacks

annotation.summary: This ability reduces the multiple attack penalty when making successive attacks against a designated mark, allowing more accurate follow-up strikes.
annotation.action_economy: varies (applies to multiple attacks within a turn)
annotation.prerequisites: must have a designated mark or target

annotation.summary: The character's skill with advanced guns improves to legendary, and their operative class DC proficiency increases to master, reflecting their renowned marksmanship.
annotation.prerequisites: Operative class; proficiency with advanced guns

annotation.summary: The character's Perception proficiency improves to the legendary rank, representing exceptional visual acuity.
annotation.prerequisites: High-level character with prior mastery in Perception

annotation.summary: When you gain an operative feat level, you may choose one feat from a list, provided you meet its prerequisites.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the specific prerequisites of the chosen feat.

annotation.summary: Instinctive Aim is a level 1 feat that can be used with a single action, likely enhancing accuracy or targeting through innate skill or intuition.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: The character simultaneously draws or switches to a ranged weapon and then takes the Aim action with it.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the same action to both draw or switch hands and then Aim.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a ranged weapon available to draw or be able to switch hands to it.

annotation.summary: Allows the character to maintain a mark on a target and extend the range at which Aim benefits apply to the first or second range increment.
annotation.action_economy: Affects the Aim action; no additional action required beyond Aim.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the ability to mark a target.

annotation.summary: This ability allows a character to move and then take a precise shot with a firearm in a single sequence.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be wielding a gun

annotation.summary: When you take the Aim action, you can also use an Interact action to activate a sight weapon upgrade, representing your natural ease with scoped targeting.
prerequisites: must have a weapon with a sight upgrade

annotation.summary: A movement-based flourish technique used by operatives to traverse terrain or reposition effectively during an encounter.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the Operative class or equivalent training.

annotation.summary: Introduces that certain key terms will appear frequently in the operative class features section.
The Aim action allows a character to focus on a target to increase accuracy and deal extra precision damage.
annotation.prerequisites: must have a visible target to focus on

annotation.summary: Defines 'Gun' as any ranged weapon possessing the analog or tech trait, and 'Mark' as the creature or object designated as the target of the Aim action.
You make a ranged attack after taking the Aim action to weaken a target's limbs, inflicting either clumsy or enfeebled until the end of your next turn, with increased severity on a critical hit.
annotation.action_economy: Requires the Aim action followed by a ranged Strike.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to perform the Aim action and make a ranged Strike against a target.

annotation.summary: Grants heightened awareness of hidden dangers, providing bonuses to Perception, AC, and saving throws against traps and unseen foes, automatic trap detection checks, and priority in initiative ties.
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: The character makes two consecutive ranged attacks against one target after taking aim. If both attacks hit, their damage is combined, applying precision damage once and applying resistances or weaknesses only once.
annotation.action_economy: Two Strikes after an Aim action
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to Aim and make ranged Strikes against a single target

annotation.summary: When an ally hits a creature, you can quickly take advantage of their attack to make a ranged Strike against the same target.
annotation.prerequisites: An ally must hit a creature with an attack to trigger this action.

annotation.summary: Peek is a level 2 Operative feat that can be used with a single action.
annotation.prerequisites: Operative class, level 2

annotation.summary: When you score a critical hit against your marked target, they suffer ongoing bleed damage equal to your number of Aim damage dice.
When the character uses the Aim action, their precision damage dice improve from d4s to d6s, representing more accurate and deadly attacks.
annotation.action_economy: Requires the Aim action to activate.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to precision damage and the ability to use the Aim action.

annotation.summary: The character takes careful aim before making a ranged attack. If the attack hits, the target becomes off-guard until the end of the character's next turn.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an Aim action followed by a ranged Strike
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to perform a ranged Strike

annotation.summary: Directs the reader to reference a table listing operative feats by their names.
A list of firearm-related feats from a tabletop role-playing game, each with an associated level requirement. The feats focus on accuracy, reflexes, tactical shooting, and defensive maneuvers.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; generally includes attack actions, reactions, and bonus actions depending on the specific ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level requirements ranging from 1 to 20; some feats may require proficiency with firearms or specific prior feats.

annotation.summary: This effect occurs when the creature you are currently Aiming at becomes dying or unconscious.
annotation.prerequisites: You must currently be Aiming at the creature.

annotation.summary: When your current target is defeated, you can immediately choose and aim at a new creature.
annotation.prerequisites: previous target must have fallen

annotation.summary: Allows the character to draw up to two one-handed weapons and take the Aim action in a single motion.
annotation.action_economy: Draw up to two one-handed weapons and perform the Aim action simultaneously.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires proficiency or training with one-handed weapons; likely part of a dual-wielding or firearm-related skill tree.

annotation.summary: A list of feats from a tabletop role-playing game, each with an associated level requirement. These feats likely enhance ranged combat, mobility, and tactical positioning, offering various combat and movement options as characters progress.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; likely includes actions, reactions, and free actions depending on the specific ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat has a minimum level requirement as indicated by the number following its name.

annotation.summary: A ranged combat maneuver allowing you to attempt to disarm a target by first aiming and then making a ranged Strike. On a hit, you use the same attack roll to compare against the target’s Reflex DC to determine if the disarm succeeds.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an Aim action followed by a ranged Strike (typically two actions total).
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to make a ranged Strike and have a target designated as your mark.

annotation.summary: Advises prioritizing Dexterity as the main ability score, with Constitution next, and choosing between Intelligence for more skills or Strength for melee combat effectiveness.
annotation.prerequisites: Character creation or ability score assignment phase

annotation.summary: A list of class or archetype abilities gained at various levels, likely representing progression of combat and mobility features.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; likely varies by ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level requirements: 1st, 4th, 6th, and 8th levels.

annotation.summary: The Disarming Shot action replaces an Athletics check to disarm an opponent. It counts as two attacks for the purpose of calculating multiple attack penalties, but the penalty only increases after the Disarming Shot is used.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; counts as two attacks within the multiple attack sequence
annotation.prerequisites: Ability or feature granting access to Disarming Shot

annotation.summary: This ability activates when the creature you most recently targeted with an Aim performs certain actions such as manipulating an object, moving, making a ranged attack, or leaving a square during movement.
annotation.prerequisites: You must have Aimed at the creature since the start of your last turn.

annotation.summary: A ranged attack that pushes the target back 5 feet on a hit, dealing extra bludgeoning damage if they collide with something, and knocking them prone on a critical hit.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an Aim action followed by a ranged Strike.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a target designated by Aim.

annotation.summary: You take careful aim and make a ranged attack that slows the target if it hits, and causes a flying target to drop slightly.
annotation.action_economy: Requires Aim followed by a ranged Strike (likely two actions total).
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a designated mark or target; must be able to Aim and make a ranged Strike.

annotation.summary: After taking the Aim action, you make a ranged Strike against your marked target. If the attack hits and the target is within your first range increment, it becomes dazzled until the end of your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: Requires the Aim action followed by a ranged Strike

annotation.summary: The character exploits an opponent's momentary vulnerability to make a ranged attack against that foe.
annotation.prerequisites: A triggering event that creates an opening in the foe's defenses.

annotation.summary: The character's sharpshooting ability increases, allowing them to maintain and target two marks simultaneously when using the Aim action.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the Aim action to apply or select two marks instead of one.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess the Sharpshooter feature or equivalent ability that allows marking targets.

annotation.summary: You make a special ranged attack that hits all creatures in a straight line between you and your target, ignoring lesser cover and applying one damage roll to all affected creatures. The attack counts as two attacks for multiple attack penalty purposes.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be wielding a firearm or ranged weapon capable of making a gun Strike.

annotation.summary: After taking the Aim action, you make a Strike that bypasses part of your target’s resistance to a chosen damage type equal to your level, and increases any weakness to that type by half your level. Immunities remain unaffected.
annotation.action_economy: Requires Aim before making a Strike
prerequisites: Must have a mark or target designated for Aim

annotation.summary: A traversal technique used by operatives to move gracefully or efficiently, often as part of a flourish or special maneuver.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; typically requires a movement or special action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the Operative class or relevant training to perform this traversal flourish.

annotation.summary: The character moves up to their full speed while simultaneously making a single ranged attack with their firearm at any point during that movement.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be wielding a firearm or ranged weapon

annotation.summary: Allows a character to perform a daring parkour move while simultaneously aiming and making a ranged attack with their firearm, even during a fall.
annotation.action_economy: Combined movement and ranged Strike as part of the same action sequence.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be wielding a firearm; must be capable of performing parkour or similar movement.

annotation.summary: When damage would drop you to 0 HP, you instead stay at 1 HP, gain temporary hit points equal to half your level for 1 minute, increase your wounded value by 1, and enter a 1-minute frenzy that cannot be ended voluntarily.
annotation.prerequisites: You must be about to take damage that would reduce you to 0 Hit Points.

annotation.summary: The ability grants automatic precision damage to all targets without needing to take the Aim action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to precision damage feature or ability

annotation.summary: When the Bullet Fever effect concludes, any temporary Hit Points granted by it are immediately lost.
prerequisites: Bullet Fever effect must have been active

annotation.summary: The character fires a burst of bullets at a target, making a ranged Strike with advantage and ignoring certain penalties and concealment checks, while consuming extra ammunition.
annotation.action_economy: Requires Aim and a ranged Strike action
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a firearm with sufficient ammunition (at least three times the weapon's expend value)

annotation.summary: When you take time to Aim and make a ranged attack against a prone or immobilized target without cover, a normal hit counts as a critical hit, and a critical hit leaves the target off-guard and suppressed until your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an Aim action followed by a ranged Strike
annotation.prerequisites: Target must be prone or immobilized and not benefiting from cover

annotation.summary: When performing the second Strike of Double Tap with the same firearm, both attacks count as one for multiple attack penalty purposes, and the precision damage bonus from Aim applies to both Strikes.
annotation.action_economy: Part of Double Tap (likely two Strikes within one action sequence)
prerequisites: Must have an active Aim precision bonus

annotation.summary: The Aim action grants its benefits when the targeted creature is within up to the fourth range increment of the weapon.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a ranged weapon and a visible target within four range increments.

annotation.summary: A special movement technique used by operatives to traverse terrain or obstacles with style and efficiency, often combining agility and flair.
annotation.action_economy: Likely requires one action or part of a move action, depending on system specifics.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the Operative class or a similar feature granting access to Flourish techniques.

annotation.summary: The character moves fluidly across the battlefield, striding up to twice and making up to three ranged attacks against different targets within the first range increment. The multiple attack penalty applies after all attacks are made.
annotation.action_economy: Two Strides and up to three ranged Strikes within a single action sequence
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to make ranged Strikes; must have multiple valid targets within first range increment

annotation.summary: The ability allows a character to take careful aim at a marked target, make a ranged Strike after Aiming, and deal maximum possible damage on a normal success. On a critical success, the character compares the doubled rolled damage to the normal maximum damage and uses whichever is higher.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an Aim action followed by a ranged Strike.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a designated mark and the ability to perform a ranged Strike.

annotation.summary: Allows a ranged attacker to bounce a shot off a solid surface within the weapon’s first range increment to reach a target, determining line of effect from the ricochet point instead of the shooter’s position. If the target is undetected, the GM rolls a secret flat check with DC 5 to determine if the attack misses.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (used as part of a ranged attack)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be using a firearm or ranged weapon capable of ricochet; requires a solid surface within first range increment.

annotation.summary: Grants an extra reaction at the start of each enemy's turn, usable only for operative reactions, reflecting the character's heightened combat readiness.
annotation.action_economy: Gain one additional reaction per enemy turn, restricted to operative reactions.
annotation.prerequisites: Extensive training or class feature granting operative reactions.

annotation.summary: The character is a skilled sharpshooter capable of performing the Aim action without spending any action cost.
annotation.action_economy: Aim can be performed as a free action instead of its normal cost.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a sharpshooter or possess equivalent training or feature.
